text: Sheila Rena Ingram (March 23, 1957 - September 1, 2020) was an American athlete. She competed mainly in the 400 metres. She was born in Washington, D.C.. She competed for United States in the 1976 Summer Olympics, winning a silver medal. Ingram died on September 1, 2020 at the age of 63.Sheila Ingram's obituary ==References== Category:1957 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American middle-distance runners Category:Olympic silver medalists for the United States Category:Sportspeople from Washington, D.C.
title: Sheila Ingram
